intro: Impatiens labordei, commonly known as the Madagascar impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Impatiens labordei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a range of growing conditions.
